value.title: Join Us! Monthly Power BI Dev Camp is Here! Starting August 27, 2020

value.title: Re-imagine headers and navigation in the Power BI Mobile apps
value.excerpt: As Power BI becomes a key tool for decision makers, more and more content is being created and published for them. Being able to easily find that content, to navigate between related items, and to share relevant content with colleagues has become critical to making these users productive when using Power

value.title: Power BI Desktop August update released - here's all that's new
value.excerpt: With the latest round of updates being pushed to Power BI, a bunch of updated AppSource visuals have been highlighted, along with the introduction of new reporting, analytics, and further components.

value.title: Power BI Desktop August 2020 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: We have exciting updates this month! The updates include support for Perspectives in Personalize visuals, rectangular select for data points, dynamic formatting support to more visuals, Direct Query support for Q&A, several new AppSource visuals, and more! Check out the full blog to learn more about

value.title: Building cross-platform solutions that connect to Power BI datasets
value.excerpt: With XMLA endpoints available in Power BI Premium and the recent release of .NET Core versions of the Analysis Services client libraries (ADOMD.NET and AMO) in public preview, you can start building modern cross-platform Power BI solutions across Windows, Linux, and macOS, and cloud-oriented environments.

value.title: Microsoft releases open source Power BI component for React
value.excerpt: The new component enables the embedding of reports, dashboards, dashboard tiles, report visuals, and more in React applications. Support for both JavaScript and TypeScript is provided.
